title: COP28: The United Arab Emirates' questionable diplomatic game
summary: This oil-production powerhouse, which is the host of the biggest climate meeting in history, is a terrible model for energy transition.

title: Hamas releases eight total hostages including a French national during extended Gaza truce
summary: Hamas freed six of the hostages hours after releasing two Israeli women Thursday afternoon under a last-minute deal to extend their cease-fire in Gaza by another day.

title: COP28's first day hails the 'loss and damage' fund's implementation as an important step forward
summary: At the opening of the climate conference in Dubai, governments unexpectedly adopted a framework for setting up a fund to help the most vulnerable countries.

title: France's dream to host 2030 Winter Olympics lives on, despite criticism
summary: The International Olympic Committee decided on Wednesday to enter into a 'targeted dialogue' with the promoters of the French Alps bid, ruling out Sweden and Switzerland. Final approval is expected sometime in 2024.

title: 'The fate of the war in Ukraine rests with the Europeans, but they are less determined than Russia'
summary: Columnist Sylvie Kauffmann observes that while the fighting continues, neither army is making headway. Faced with the prospect of a protracted war, the Russians are rearming and the West is questioning its next step.

title: Elliott Erwitt, renowned American photographer, passes away at 95
summary: The photographer was acclaimed for capturing iconic moments in American history as well as quirky photos of dogs and their owners. A stalwart of the Magnum agency, his passing was announced by them on Thursday.

title: Death of Henry Kissinger: The grey areas of an eminence grise
summary: The former head of US diplomacy, who became an influential advisor, will be remembered as the architect of détente with the East. But his involvement in some of history's darkest episodes is now supported by a wealth of evidence.

title: Phasing out fossil fuels: Will COP28 end up breaking the taboo?
summary: Fossil fuel producers have so far kept their product, which is responsible for 80% of greenhouse gas emissions, out of climate negotiations. As the COP28 gets underway in Dubai, this has become an untenable position.

title: Prosecutor requests suspended sentence for French ex-president Sarkozy
summary: In 2021, former President Nicolas Sarkozy was originally sentenced to one year of house arrest. The one-year suspended sentence requested in this appeals trial is more lenient.

title: Before the war, emigration from Gaza to Europe was booming
summary: In 2023, Palestinians were the largest group of new asylum seekers on the Greek islands. They came via Turkey, where they were easily granted access to visas.

title: With the 2030 World Expo, Saudi Arabia dreams of becoming a tourism destination
summary: The organization of the event was entrusted to Riyadh by the Bureau International des Expositions on November 28. It's a way for the Wahhabi kingdom to position itself as an international tourist hotspot.

title: Russia bans 'international LGBT movement' for 'extremism'
summary: The move cements a long crackdown on the community as the Kremlin pushes ultra-conservative social values.

title: Shane MacGowan, The Pogues frontman, dies at 65
summary: MacGowan, an inspiring lead singer who merged Irish melodies and punk passion in his songs, received a Lifetime Achievement Award in 2018 to celebrate his contribution to modern Irish music.

title: Josephine, the slave-owner who whispered in Napoleon's ear
summary: Ridley Scott's biopic, released on November 22, sidesteps a debate that divides historians: Born in Martinique into a family of wealthy landowners, did the future empress push her husband to re-establish slavery overseas in 1802?

title: COP28: Saudi Arabia builds it clean energy transition on oil profits
summary: The world's leading oil producer, with over 15% of the world's proven reserves, the Saudi kingdom remains highly dependent on hydrocarbons for its domestic energy consumption and exports.

title: China has no plans to make commitments under pressure at UN COP28 conference
summary: China continues to authorize the construction of new coal-fired power plants even as solar and wind power production grows at a record pace.

title: UK RMT rail union accepts deal to halt long-running strikes
summary: The other key transport union, Aslef, which represents drivers, has yet to come to an agreement. A new series of rolling strikes across the country are scheduled to go ahead from this weekend.

title: Pope Francis' health forces him to pull out of COP28
summary: A lung inflammation prevented the head of the Catholic Church from attending the climate conference in Dubai.
